item.title: Davena add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Davena add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "You — you strange — you almost unearthly thing! — I love as my own flesh. You — poor and obscure, and small and plain as you are — I entreat to accept me as a husband." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Davena add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am not deceitful: if I were, I should say I loved you; but I declare I do not love you: I dislike you the worst of anybody in the world." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Davena add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I do not think, sir, you have any right to command me, merely because you are older than I, or because you have seen more of the world than I have; your claim to superiority depends on the use you have made of your time and experience." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Davena add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I ask you to pass through life at my side—to be my second self, and best earthly companion." -- Charlotte Brontë
